newsitem.title: CHINA: HOPEWELL SAYS NOT AWARE OF THAI DEADLINE.
newsitem.headline: HOPEWELL SAYS NOT AWARE OF THAI DEADLINE.

text.p: Hopewell Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it had not been informed of a new 10-day deadline set by the Thai government to clear up financial difficulties over its Bangkok mass transit project.
"It's another self-imposed deadline from the Thai government. Hopewell has not formally been advised of this development," a spokeswoman said.

She said Hopewell was still in discussions with its bankers on a financing solution but did not know when talks would reach a conclusion. "We are confident that we can find a way forward," the spokeswoman added.

Sathien Vongvichien, Thailand's deputy permanent secretary for transport and communications, said on Tuesday the Thai government had ordered Hopewell to resolve its problems and report back within 10 days or face losing the 30-year operating concession for the Bangkok Elevated Road and Train System.
